com.nordicid.nurapi

Interface NurApiTransport


  • public interface NurApiTransport
    Implements the transport class that the API uses for communication.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect()
      Connect is called when the transport is created.
      boolean disableAck()
      Return true if this transport type does not need NurApi ACK.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the module/client.
      boolean isConnected()
      Return true if module or client is currently connected.
      int readData(byte[] buffer)
      Read data from the module/client.
      int writeData(byte[] buffer, int len)
      Write data to transport layer.

    • Method Detail

      • readData

        int readData(byte[] buffer)
      throws java.io.IOException
        Read data from the module/client.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Preallocated buffer to read data into.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes read or -1 on error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - May throw this exception upon transport's fatal error.

      • writeData

        int writeData(byte[] buffer,
              int len)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Write data to transport layer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Data to write.
        len - Length of the data.
        Returns:
        Number of bytes written or -1 on error.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - May throw this exception upon transport's fatal error.

      • connect

        void connect()
      throws java.lang.Exception
        Connect is called when the transport is created.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - May throw exception if the transport for any reason is not valid or cannot currently be connected to.

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the module/client.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Return true if module or client is currently connected.
        Returns:
        Return true if connected.

      • disableAck

        boolean disableAck()
        Return true if this transport type does not need NurApi ACK. Typically ACK is enabled for serial and ethernet transports
        Returns:
        Return true if this transport type does not need NurApi ACK
